intro: Calceolaria biflora f. falklandica, commonly known as the Falkland Islands calceolaria, is a rare and unique plant native to the Falkland Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive calyces that resemble small pouches. The plant typically grows in coastal areas with sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in the cool, maritime climate of the region. It produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pink and purple, which bloom during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
